contents.content: Just by looking up at the night sky, you can probably tell that stars are not all the same color. Some stars emit a lot of blue light, while others emit a lot of red light. Likewise, there are objects in space that emit large amounts of infrared or ultraviolet light.

In the next section of the investigation, you will learn a few ways that light is used to explore:

  • How infrared light is used to see into dusty nebulae and find dim red stars
  • How infrared light is used to locate very distant galaxies
  • How red light is used to locate the star-forming regions in galaxies
